result.execSummary:
The defendant Angel M Zamarripa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Straight time, with 1 day credit.  No Huber release.
If the defendant is revoked, the defendant will serve straight time, with 1 day credit. No Huber release.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered.
Court waived all non mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation agent.
Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs; no edibles.
If defendant successfully completes probation and pays all court costs, fees and surcharges, the Court will grant expungement.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angel M Zamarripa

records.addlTxt: Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/waiver of Rights received and filed.

Defendant Angel M Zamarripa in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Angel M Zamarripa.  Prosecuting attorney Jessica Ann Behling in court on behalf of Mallory Davis for the State of Wisconsin. 

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT 2 : Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state, defense counsel and defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION.  COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 12 months.
.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
-provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-Court waived all non mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent;
-absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs; no edibles.
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation agent;

If the defendant is revoked, the defendant will serve straight time, with 1 day credit.  No Huber release.
If defendant successfully completes probation and pays all court costs, fees and surcharges, the Court will grant expungement.

Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Angel M Zamarripa in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
All parties appeared in court in the afternoon.  Case heard off the record.  Case is adjourned to 9-9-22 at 2:30 pm for plea and sentencing.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Case in court for a status conference.  Defendant does not appear. Case is adjourned to 6-27-22 at 8:30 am for status conference.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
OFF THE RECORD:  Defense counsel requests status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angel M Zamarripa in court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Angel M Zamarripa appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
OFF THE RECORD: Status Conference held.  Defense counsel is in trial and is unable to appear.  Defendant present by zoom and was given next court date.  ADA and defense counsel emailed new court dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Angel M Zamarripa in court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Michael Plaisted, present in court/in court via telephone, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $75.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. 
  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Angel M Zamarripa
Current: 2609 S 8th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215   (Effective: 02-23-2022)
Prior: 1433 West National Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53204

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (2/25/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Angel M Zamarripa in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 10.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/23/22 @ 1p
